result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Alexander Evans

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Alexander Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Charles Alexander Evans.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Case has a co-defendant that is tabbed to Judge Childs in branch 02. State requests this case be re-tabbed  based on a previous recusal that no longer take effect. Defense requests to have substitution withdrawn. Court grants the requests of the parties and order case to be re-tabbed to Judge Childs in Branch 02 to tag along with co-defendant matter in case 22CF2291. Court further order defense's request for substitution withdrawn. Defense still have the right to request for substitution. Court adjourns matter for a status conference in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.

Defendant Charles Alexander Evans in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Charles Alexander Evans in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Alexander Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Castro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Theodore O'Reilly on behalf of Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Charles Alexander Evans not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Fitzsimmons is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Alexander Evans not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dollar General, Walgreens, TSS, ARG, JJR, GS, JM
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Charles Alexander Evans in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Charles Alexander Evans in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Alexander Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
